intro: Cynoglossum villosulum, commonly known as the hairy mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rounded leaves and small, pale blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, preferring moist and well-drained conditions. It is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer. The hairy texture of its leaves and stems is a distinguishing feature that aids in its identification.
